metadata.title: CVE-2014-8625 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
Multiple format string vulnerabilities in the parse_error_msg function inparsehelp.c in dpkg before 1.17.22 allow remote attackers to cause a denialof service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via format stringspecifiers in the (1) package or (2) architecture name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dpkg - 1.17.24ubuntu1
dselect - 1.17.24ubuntu1
libdpkg-perl - 1.17.24ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dpkg package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.17.24ubuntu1').
